image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born in Middletown, Ohio, April 6, 1941; B.A., Alderson-Broaddus College, Philippi, W.Va., 1964; M.A., American University, Washington, D.C., 1975; United States Navy, 1964-1988; stock broker; member of the Virginia state senate, 1995-2001; elected as a Republican to the One Hundred Seventh and to the succeeding Congress (January 3, 2001-January 3, 2005); not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Ninth Congress in 2004.

researchRecord.name: 1999-2004, 24 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: A large portion of the Edward L. Schrock Collection is composed of constituent feedback in the form of letters, postcards, petitions, surveys, and opinion ballots. Also included are a small number of letters from Schrock to constituents and correspondence with colleagues; committee business for the U.S. House of Representatives Committee on Small Business; and reference material related to various issues and legislation. A finding aid is available in the repository and online.
